overview.description: Pet Refinement is a secondary enhancement system separate from pet leveling. It uses Wild Marks to randomly adjust the pet's troop buff percentages (Attack and Defense). Refinement provides additional stat bonuses on top of the base level stats, with a maximum cap that varies by pet rarity and generation.

unlock_requirements.notes: Same as pet system unlock. Refinement is available once you have a pet.

relationship_to_leveling.description: Pet leveling (via Pet Food) provides base Attack and Defense % bonuses that increase deterministically with each level. Refinement (via Wild Marks) provides a SEPARATE additional bonus percentage on top of level bonuses. The max refinement value caps how high the wild mark bonus can go.
relationship_to_leveling.example: A Mammoth at L100 provides 33.52% base Attack/Defense from leveling. Refinement via Wild Marks can add up to 49.16% more on top of that.
relationship_to_leveling.notes: The exact relationship between base stats and refinement bonuses is inferred from multiple sources. The wiki shows 'base/refined' values at advancement milestones, but the max refinement percentages from whiteoutsurvival.app are much higher, indicating wild mark refinement is a separate system.

process.description: Using a Wild Mark triggers a random re-roll of the pet's refinement stat bonuses. The new values may be higher or lower than current values. Players then choose whether to accept or reject the new values.
steps: 1. Select a pet and tap Refine
2. Choose Common Wild Mark (standard refinement) or Advanced Wild Mark (advanced refinement)
3. The game calculates new random stat values
4. If stats improved: green indicator appears with 'Replace' button
5. If stats decreased: red indicator appears with warning
6. Tap 'Replace' to preview the new stats
7. Tap 'Confirm' to apply the new stats (IRREVERSIBLE)
8. Tap 'Continue' to skip/reject the roll (Wild Mark is still consumed)

randomness.description: Refinement outcomes are random/probabilistic. Each refinement attempt can increase or decrease individual stat bonuses. This is NOT a guaranteed linear progression.

irreversibility.description: Once you tap Confirm to apply new refinement stats, the change is permanent and cannot be undone.

warning_system.description: The game shows a secondary confirmation prompt ONLY when there is a drop in Total Power. It does NOT warn for individual stat line decreases if overall power stays the same or increases.

quality_protection.description: If you refine your pet after improving its quality (rarity upgrade), the secondary stats quality will NOT decrease below the new quality tier. This is a floor protection mechanism.

stat_types.description: Refinement affects the pet's passive troop buff percentages. All pets provide Attack and Defense bonuses to ALL troops (not troop-type-specific). Refinement adjusts these general Attack/Defense buff percentages.

refinable_stats.description: Percentage bonus to attack for all troop types (Infantry, Lancer, Marksman)
Percentage bonus to defense for all troop types (Infantry, Lancer, Marksman)

stat_types.notes: Based on whiteoutsurvival.app data, all pets provide Attack and Defense as their two base stat lines from leveling. Refinement adjusts these same stat categories. It is not confirmed whether refinement can also roll Lethality or Health sub-stats.

color_quality_tiers.description: Refinement buffs have a color-coded quality tier that indicates the strength of the current refinement. Tiers progress from lowest to highest quality.

common_wild_mark.description: A stone imbued with a subtle touch of the wild, which can stir a pet's instincts to some extent. Used for standard pet refinement.
common_wild_mark.usage: Standard refinement. Use for Gray -> Green -> Blue -> Purple tier progression.
common_wild_mark.gem_cost_note: 500 gems per 1 Common Wild Mark from Gem Shop

advanced_wild_mark.description: A stone imbued with a subtle touch of the wild, which can fully unleash a pet's potential. Used for pet advanced refinement.
advanced_wild_mark.usage: Advanced refinement. Use ONLY after at least one pet buff reaches Purple quality. More effective at higher tiers.

strategy.description: Use Common Wild Marks to progress refinement from Gray through Blue tiers. Once at least one buff reaches Purple quality, switch to Advanced Wild Marks for more efficient progression toward Gold tier. Using Advanced Wild Marks before Purple is wasteful.
key_rules: Always use Common Wild Marks for Gray -> Green -> Blue progression
Switch to Advanced Wild Marks ONLY when at least one buff reaches Purple
Advanced Wild Marks are more effective at higher quality tiers (Purple+)
Save Wild Marks for SvS Prep Day 3 for maximum point value
Refine whenever you have marks available - take solid improvements when offered
Don't be greedy - accept good rolls rather than risking decreases

svs_integration.description: Wild Marks give SvS Prep points when used on Day 3 (Beast Slay day). Save Wild Marks for SvS for maximum value.
svs_integration.strategy: Save ALL Wild Marks for SvS Prep Day 3. Advanced Wild Marks are worth 15,000 points each (same as Lucky Wheel tickets). Common Wild Marks are worth 1,150 points each.

pet_level_stat_progression.description: Base Attack/Defense % bonuses from pet leveling (separate from wild mark refinement). All pets give equal Attack and Defense bonuses. Shown here for SSR pets (max L100).

ssr_pet_progression.notes: Post-advancement values represent the stat after completing the advancement milestone at each 10-level gate (requires Taming Manual + Energizing Potion + Strengthening Serum). Base values are the stat just before advancement.

frostscale_chameleon.description: Newest SSR pet (Gen 7) with the highest refinement cap of any pet. Not in the original pets.research.json. Added to game later.
frostscale_chameleon.name: Frostscale Chameleon
frostscale_chameleon.skill_effect: Reduces enemy Troops' Defense by 2.5%/3%/3.5%/4%/5%/6%/7%/8%/9%/10% for 2 hours
frostscale_chameleon.notes: This pet provides an enemy defense debuff rather than a friendly buff, making it unique among SSR pets. Defense reduction benefits ALL rally participants, similar to hero enemy debuff skills.
